text: Previously , an inducible enhancer between nucleotides -299 and -228 that contains NF-kappa B and CArG motifs was identified .

We now report the characterization of a second essential positive regulatory element located between nucleotides -137 and -64 that binds <extra_id_0> Elf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> HMG-I(Y) <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: This element had maximal activity in lymphoid cells , paralleling the cell type specificity of <extra_id_0> Elf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .

Transcription from the <extra_id_0> IL-2R alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter was inhibited when either the <extra_id_0> Elf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or the <extra_id_0> HMG-I(Y) <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding site was mutated .

text: Coexpression of both proteins activated transcription of the -137 to -64 element in COS-7 cells .

<extra_id_0> Elf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> physically associated with <extra_id_0> HMG-I <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and with NF-kappa B <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in vitro , suggesting that protein - protein interactions might functionally coordinate the actions of the upstream and downstream positive regulatory elements .

text: This is the first report of a physical interaction between an Ets family member and NF-kappa B family proteins .

These findings provide significant new insights into the protein - protein and protein - DNA interactions that regulate cell-type - specific and inducible <extra_id_0> IL-2R alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression and also have implications for other genes regulated by <extra_id_0> Elf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and NF-kappa B family proteins .
